Rule.NonCompliantComment: Cron daemon is not enabled, risking failure of scheduled jobs.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable the cron daemon and ensure it is active.
Rule.Correction: systemctl enable cron; systemctl start cron
Rule.Verification: systemctl is-active cron | grep -q "active" && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: File permissions on /etc/crontab are not properly set, which may allow unauthorized modifications.
Permissions on files in /etc/cron.hourly are too permissive.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set the correct permissions (644) on all files in /etc/cron.hourly.
Rule.Verification: for file in /etc/cron.hourly/*; do stat -c "%a" "$file" | grep -q "^644$" || exit 1; done; echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Cron access is not restricted to authorized users.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Create or update the cron.allow file to list only authorized users.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The at command is not restricted, which may allow unauthorized job scheduling.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Restrict the at command by configuring at.allow (and/or at.deny) appropriately.
